In this session we extend the 1D reaction-diffusion workflow to **two spatial dimensions**. We will use finite differences, explicit Euler time stepping, and Matplotlib animations to explore pattern formation.

## Case Studies

[Gierer-Meinhardt 2D](gierer-meinhardt.qmd){.btn .btn-primary} [Turing Instability (2D)](turing-instability.qmd){.btn .btn-primary} [Gray-Scott](gray-scott.qmd){.btn .btn-primary} [Assignment](assignment.qmd){.btn .btn-secondary}

## What do we need?

### `numpy`

We use NumPy arrays to store 2D fields and `np.roll()` to compute discrete Laplacians.

### `matplotlib.pyplot`

Initialize figures, axes, and static plot elements.

### `matplotlib.animation`

Update image data frame-by-frame to animate the dynamics.

### `matplotlib.backend_bases`

Handle user interaction (mouse clicks and key presses).

### `scipy`

Great for ODEs, but we will **not** use it for PDEs in this session.
